body:
<sup><sup>*Changelog generated by [Shipkit Changelog Gradle Plugin](https://github.com/shipkit/shipkit-changelog)*</sup></sup>

#### 4.1.0
 - 2022-11-26 - [6 commit(s)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/compare/4.0.0...4.1.0) by Niklas Seyfarth, Tim van der Lippe, Vetle Leinonen-Roeim, taeyeonKim, wrongwrong
 - Update Shipkit versions [(#468)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/468)
 - Also trigger release on 4.x tags [(#466)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/466)
 - Ease verify inOrder for suspending functions [(#464)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/464)
 - Upgrading Gradle to 6.9.2, Kotlin to 1.4.20, junit to 4.13.2 and mockito to 4.4.0 [(#458)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/458)
 - Add LenientStubber [(#454)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/454)
 - Remove jcenter [(#450)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/450)
 - Add support for per-mock strictness [(#325)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/issues/325)

<sup><sup>*Changelog generated by [Shipkit Changelog Gradle Plugin](https://github.com/shipkit/shipkit-changelog)*</sup></sup>

#### 4.0.0
 - 2021-10-12 - [7 commit(s)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/compare/3.2.0...4.0.0) by Michal Szestowicki, Rashad Sookram, Szczepan Faber, Tim van der Lippe, Vetle Leinonen-Roeim, andreprinz
 - Run releases on Mockito-kotlin 4 [(#448)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/448)
 - Remove deprecated verifyZeroInteractions [(#447)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/447)
 - Remove verifyZeroInteractions? [(#446)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/issues/446)
 - Bump mockito-core to 3.12.4 [(#444)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/444)
 - Enable automated changelog [(#435)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/435)
 - Add verifyNoInteractions, mark verifyZeroInteractions as deprecated [(#401)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/401)

<sup><sup>*Changelog generated by [Shipkit Changelog Gradle Plugin](https://github.com/shipkit/shipkit-changelog)*</sup></sup>

#### 2.2.6
 - 2021-03-22 - [22 commit(s)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/compare/2.2.0...2.2.6) by Szczepan Faber, Tim van der Lippe
 - Enabled automated releases [(#412)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/412)
 - Enabled releases to Maven Central [(#411)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/411)
 - Rename packages to org.mockito.kotlin [(#410)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/410)
 - Automated releases [(#409)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/409)
 - Enabled releases to GitHub and Bintray [(#405)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/405)
 - Added CI + Bintray releases [(#402)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/402)
 - Add acknowledgements section to the README [(#399)](https://github.com/mockito/mockito-kotlin/pull/399)

- Add reified support for refEq like other matchers https://github.com/nhaarman/mockito-kotlin/pull/329
 - Make after() return type non-null https://github.com/nhaarman/mockito-kotlin/pull/351
 - Support lenient in mock and withSettings https://github.com/nhaarman/mockito-kotlin/pull/353

New in this version:

 - Add BDD will extension function #313 
 - Coroutines verify with verification mode #318 (#317)

Version 2.x introduces some breaking changes:

 - The artifact to include is now `com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:x.x.x`;
 - The main package to import from is now `com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2`;
 - Mockito-Kotlin does not depend on `kotlin-reflect` anymore. This solves a few conflict issues when using different Kotlin versions. The artifact `mockito-kotlin-kt1.1` is therefore dropped.
   - This removes the creation of arbitrary instances through reflection, which was not necessary anyway due to the `T as null` quirk.


To include this, use the following:

```
testCompile 'com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:2.0.0'
```

If you included a dependency on `kotlin-reflect` for Mockito-Kotlin only, you can remove it.

name: 2.0.0-RC3
body:
Version 2.x will introduce some breaking changes:

 - The artifact to include is now `com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:x.x.x`;
 - The main package to import from is now `com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2`;
 - Mockito-Kotlin does not depend on `kotlin-reflect` anymore. This solves a few conflict issues when using different Kotlin versions. The artifact `mockito-kotlin-kt1.1` is therefore dropped.
   - This removes the creation of arbitrary instances through reflection, which was not necessary anyway due to the `T as null` quirk.


To try this release, use the following:

```
testCompile 'com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:2.0.0-RC3'
```

If you included a dependency on `kotlin-reflect` for Mockito-Kotlin only, you can remove it.

Changes since `2.0.0-RC2`:

 - Updates Mockito to 2.23.0
   - This enables support for stable coroutines
 - Include `argThat(ArgumentMatcher<T>)` function #281 
 - Remove a deprecated `doReturn` function (#274)

This should be the last RC before `2.0.0` is released, which will be some time after Kotlin 1.3 is released.

name: 2.0.0-RC2
body:
Version 2.x will introduce some breaking changes:

 - The artifact to include is now `com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:x.x.x`;
 - The main package to import from is now `com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2`;
 - Mockito-Kotlin does not depend on `kotlin-reflect` anymore. This solves a few conflict issues when using different Kotlin versions. The artifact `mockito-kotlin-kt1.1` is therefore dropped.
   - This removes the creation of arbitrary instances through reflection, which was not necessary anyway due to the `T as null` quirk.


To try this release, use the following:

```
testCompile 'com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:2.0.0-RC2'
```

If you included a dependency on `kotlin-reflect` for Mockito-Kotlin only, you can remove it.

Changes since `2.0.0-RC1`:

 - Updates Mockito to 2.21.0
 - Inline `whenever` to let Mockito's UnfinishedStubbing messages work (#278)
 - Replace OngoingStubbing<T>.doReturn(List<T>) with doReturnConsecutively (#279)

name: 2.0.0-RC1
body:
Version 2.x will introduce some breaking changes:

 - The artifact to include is now `com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:x.x.x`;
 - The main package to import from is now `com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2`;
 - Mockito-Kotlin does not depend on `kotlin-reflect` anymore. This solves a few conflict issues when using different Kotlin versions. The artifact `mockito-kotlin-kt1.1` is therefore dropped.
   - This removes the creation of arbitrary instances through reflection, which was not necessary anyway due to the `T as null` quirk.


To try this release, use the following:

```
testCompile 'com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:2.0.0-RC1'
```

If you included a dependency on `kotlin-reflect` for Mockito-Kotlin only, you can remove it.

Changes since `2.0.0-alpha04`:

 - Updates Mockito to 2.19.0
 - Support mocking with constructor arguments. This breaks code that currently uses useConstructor = true, which can simply be replaced by useConstructor = parameterless(). (#266)
Updates Mockito version to 2.18.3

name: 2.0.0-alpha04
body:
- Makes `inOrder` inline (#248)
 - Adhere to ArgumentMatcher contract (#253)
 - Includes overloads for argumentCaptor (#254)

```groovy
com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:2.0.0-alpha04
```

name: 2.0.0-alpha03
body:
- Updates Mockito to `2.13.0`
 - Adds support for coroutines

name: 2.0.0-alpha01
body:
Version 2.x will introduce some breaking changes:

 - The artifact to include is now `com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:x.x.x`;
 - The main package to import from is now `com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2`;
 - Mockito-Kotlin does not depend on `kotlin-reflect` anymore. This solves a few conflict issues when using different Kotlin versions. The artifact `mockito-kotlin-kt1.1` is therefore dropped.
   - This removes the creation of arbitrary instances through reflection, which was not necessary anyway due to the `T as null` quirk.


To try this release, use the following:

```
testCompile 'com.nhaarman.mockitokotlin2:mockito-kotlin:2.0.0-alpha01'
```

If you included a dependency on `kotlin-reflect` for Mockito-Kotlin only, you can remove it.

- `same()` now returns `T` instead of `T?`
 - Updates Mockito to `2.8.9`
 - Introduces a new artifact for usage with Kotlin `1.1.x`:

```groovy
compile 'com.nhaarman:mockito-kotlin-kt1.1:x.x.x'
```

- Adds an extension function to stub a mock after its creation ( #158 )
 - Updates Mockito to `2.7.21`
 - Updates Kotlin to `1.0.7`

- Updates Mockito to 2.7.5
 - Adds `doAnswer` to `OngoingStubbing` ( #152 )

- Updates Mockito to 2.6.5
- Introduces an enhanced settings API ( #149 ); see #148.

- Updates Mockito to 2.4.5
- Updates Kotlin to 1.0.6
- Adds `argWhere` ( #141 )
- Adds BDDMockito functions ( #142 )

- Properly handles `null` values in argument matchers ( #133 )
- Throws a descriptive error when `null` is passed to the `check` function ( #134 )

This is the first major release for Mockito-Kotlin.

# What is Mockito-Kotlin?

Mockito-Kotlin is a wrapper library around [Mockito](https://github.com/mockito/mockito).  

It provides top-level functions to allow for a more idiomatic approach while using Mockito in Kotlin.
Furthermore, Mockito returns `null` values for calls to method like `any()`, which can cause `NullPointerExceptions` when passing them to non-nullable parameters. This library solves that issue by trying to create actual instances to return.

Mockito-Kotlin does not intend to _alter_ any of the functionality that Mockito provides, except in places where crucial for working with Kotlin.

See the [Wiki](https://github.com/nhaarman/mockito-kotlin/wiki) to find out how to work with Mockito-Kotlin.

name: 1.0.0-RC1
body:
This is the first and possibly only release candidate for Mockito-Kotlin 1.0.0.

Changes in this version:
- Removes any deprecated methods.
- `isA()` returns a non-null instance

- Updates Kotlin to 1.0.5-2
- Updates Mockito to 2.2.17
- `inOrder` accepts a lambda for easy verification (#122)

- Updates Kotlin to 1.0.5
- Updates Mockito to 2.2.15
- `eq()` returns passed value, and accepts nullable values (#117)
- Uses `null as T` as default return type, with the create instance mechanism as a fallback.

- More convenient API for stubbing nullable types
- Adds a fallback to the constructors when mocking a class fails

- Fixes a NPE thrown when trying to mock a generic type (#104)
- Doesn't try to mock primitive and wrapper types anymore (#106)

- Updates Mockito to 2.2.9
- Fixes an infinite loop caused by 'copy constructors' (#99)
- Adds `nullableArgumentCaptor` to be able to work with lists of nullables (#100)
  - Change in the way an 'easiest' constructor is found by skipping optional parameters (#101)

- First release on Maven Central
  - Add `mavenCentral()` to your repositories if necessary.
- Updates Mockito to 2.2.6
- Marks deprecated methods as `ERROR`, `ReplaceWith` suggestions are supplied.

- Updates Mockito to 2.2.1
- Fixes issues:
  - #37 - ClassCastException when using `mock-maker-inline`
  - #75 - Attempting to verify mocked calls with a class that has a string array parameter in its constructor throws UnsupportedOperationException
- Add `doThrow` infix methods to OngoingStubbing (#90)
- Deprecates `capture { }` in favor of `argThat { }`, `argForWhich { }` or `check { }` (#91)

- Upgrades Mockito version to 2.1.0-beta.125
- Improve `easiestConstructor()` to sort by parameters size
- Deprecate methods that are deprecated in Mockito
- Make anyArray() accept nullable types

- Upgrades Mockito to `2.0.99-beta`.  
    **This removes the `stub` method, [like in Mockito](https://github.com/mockito/mockito/pull/404).**
- Accept stubbing lamdas in `mock()`

- Updates the Kotlin version to `1.0.3` (#51)
- Use explicit return types for calls to Mockito (#50)
- `doReturn` accepts `null` values (#34)
